measure.title: Ban on free movement for people arriving from abroad
measure.meta_description: Free movement of persons arriving from abroad is prohibited.

content.processed:
Prohibits all persons referred to in clause I.2, including persons as referred to in clause I.2 (a) through (c) and (e), from freely moving around the territory of the entire Czech Republic during their stay in the territory of the Czech Republic, or for a period of 10 days, or until they present the result of an RT-PCR test for the presence of SARS CoV-2 as referred to in clause I.3 or until the termination of the quarantine measure, with the exception of the following:

  1. trips to work and movement involved in performing a job, and trips taken to perform business or other similar activities, including trips to educational institutions and any movement involved in performing this activity; this does not apply to proceedings referred to in clause I.11;

  2. trips absolutely necessary to procure basic necessities of life, to take care of children or to take care of animals; the use of necessary financial and postal services; refuelling vehicles;

  3. trips to medical facilities and welfare facilities;

  4. trips taken to take care of urgent official matters;

  5. trips back to one’s place of residence;

  6. funerals;

This prohibition does not apply to persons below the age of 5.

To foreigners referred to in clause I.11, the free movement restriction applies for a period of 10 days.
